title: Sans Serif
content:
Can someone name that font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829133000im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lg2-mrcup-19_4567.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lg2-mrcup-19.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829133000/http:/typophile.com/files/lg2-mrcup-19.jpg) | 90.45 KB |
author: Phillip Rodolfi

comments.content:
Seems to be custom branding by lg2boutique [http://lg2boutique.com/en/work/464/hangar-29-branding](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829133000/http:/lg2boutique.com/en/work/464/hangar-29-branding "http://lg2boutique.com/en/work/464/hangar-29-branding")  
The word HANGAR is in the style of Sans octagonal/Sans angled.  
For a comparable base font see House Industries United Sans Semi Condensed Black  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829133000/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection")  
and Ryan Clark's Liberator  
 [http://www.losttype.com/font/?name=liberator](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829133000/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=liberator "http://www.losttype.com/font/?name=liberator")  
To make the word HANGAR the upper terminal of the G needs to be clipped and the chin squared. Also all corners should be rounded, in the style of Blender by Binnenland Nik Thoenen [http://www.binnenland.ch/font/about/Blender](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829133000/http:/www.binnenland.ch/font/about/Blender "http://www.binnenland.ch/font/about/Blender")  
Don
